Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
toss: Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and have opted to field

Commentary Text: Ashwin to Abhinav Manohar, 1 run, taps this towards cover for a single
team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
team_b_11: Gujarat Titans (Playing XI): Matthew Wade(w), Shubman Gill, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Yash Dayal
team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
toss: Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and have opted to field

Commentary Text: Ashwin to Abhinav Manohar, no run, Abhinav Manohar did well to plonk his back leg back just in time to avoid walking back. The presence of mind was spot on despite being totally beaten by a carrom ball and the balance being all over the place. Abhinav had no clue and was caught on the crease, poking at the ball. Quick work from Samson behind the sticks
team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
team_b_11: Gujarat Titans (Playing XI): Matthew Wade(w), Shubman Gill, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Yash Dayal
team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
toss: Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and have opted to field

team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
toss: Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and have opted to field

He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
team_b_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
team_b_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11). Commentary Text: Neesham to Abhinav Manohar, FOUR, thick edge and it beats Samson diving to his right. Good length outside off, Abhinav Manohar opens the face but gets it finer than he would've wanted. No chance for Samson on the dive

When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

Commentary Text: Riyan Parag to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Shubman Gill holes out to long-on. Nehra the GT coach grimaces. The ball comes out with the seam wobbling all around, full outside off, Shubman Gill gets forward to loft but more off the inside half of the bat but it still carries all the way for an overhead catch which is held by Hetmyer just inside the ropes. Just a bit more elevation would've cleared the West Indian. Riyan Parag roars though. The plan has come off. Shubman Gill c Hetmyer b Riyan Parag 13(14) [4s-2]

Commentary Text: Riyan Parag to Shubman Gill, FOUR, flat length ball on middle and leg, Shubman Gill short-arm jabs the pull through square leg and beats Rassie on the deep square fence, as the ball runs away from his dive
team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
team_b_11: Gujarat Titans (Playing XI): Matthew Wade(w), Shubman Gill, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Yash Dayal
team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

Commentary Text: Riyan Parag to Hardik Pandya, SIX, not sure this is a good idea by Samson to bring on Riyan Parag against Hardik Pandya. Full outside off, smeared straight back over the bowler's head for a flat six

Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
toss: Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and have opted to field

Commentary Text: Prasidh to Shubman Gill, FOUR, good ball, very full outside off, but Shubman Gill crouches low and carves it between cover-point and point, right into the gap and it races away again. Was in the air for a while but in the gap too
team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
team_b_11: Gujarat Titans (Playing XI): Matthew Wade(w), Shubman Gill, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Yash Dayal
team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
team_b_11: Gujarat Titans (Playing XI): Matthew Wade(w), Shubman Gill, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Yash Dayal
team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
toss: Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and have opted to field

team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
team_b_11: Gujarat Titans (Playing XI): Matthew Wade(w), Shubman Gill, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Yash Dayal
team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
toss: Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and have opted to field

Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
team_b_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
team_b_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Commentary Text: Kuldeep Sen to Shankar, out Caught by Samson!! Kuldeep Sen strikes. Not the delivery he would've wanted to take a wicket. Short and wide outside off, Shankar throws the bat at it but bottom-edges it behind to Samson who makes no mistake. Kuldeep Sen points to the RR crest on his jersey in celebration. The feet did not move for Shankar there, he just reached out and actually did well to get the edge to a fairly widish delivery. Another failure for him and it's RR on top here. Shankar c Samson b Kuldeep Sen 2(7)

Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
