Commentary Text: Rashid Khan to Buttler, no run, 97.4kph, full and quick around off, defensively pushed back at the bowler
team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
team_b_11: Gujarat Titans (Playing XI): Matthew Wade(w), Shubman Gill, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Yash Dayal
team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

toss: Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and have opted to field

Commentary Text: Rashid Khan to Ashwin, no run, 91.9kph, in-drifter, Ashwin gets forward to cover-drive and inside-edges to short fine
team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal

And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Commentary Text: Rashid Khan to Ashwin, SIX, 96.9kph, Ashwin takes the aerial route and makes superb contact. In-drifter, full and in the slot, Ashwin gets underneath it and hoists it handsomely over long-on. Wow!
team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
team_b_11: Gujarat Titans (Playing XI): Matthew Wade(w), Shubman Gill, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Yash Dayal
team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

Commentary Text: Yash Dayal to Buttler, FOUR, 18 runs off the over! 138kph, overpitched outside off, not much feet movement but Buttler leans and drives it neatly all along the carpet through extra cover. Buttler - 48 off 20 balls!

Commentary Text: Yash Dayal to Buttler, no run, Yash Dayal switches to round the wicket, bowls a short of length ball on middle and leg. Buttler loses his shape a bit as he inside-halves the pull to mid-wicket
team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
team_b_11: Gujarat Titans (Playing XI): Matthew Wade(w), Shubman Gill, Vijay Shankar, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Yash Dayal
team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. Commentary Text: Yash Dayal to Buttler, FOUR, mistimed, in the air, but it's a boundary. Dropped short again by Yash Dayal, Buttler clears his front leg to pull. More off the top-edge but he's got enough wood on it to beat the mid-on fielder running back

His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
toss: Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and have opted to field

Commentary Text: Shami to Ashwin, 1 run, 142.5kph, a nothing shot from Ashwin. Short ball, Ashwin attempts to pull it over mid-wicket/mid-on and ends up playing awkwardly as the ball gets big on him. team_b_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

Commentary Text: Yash Dayal to Padikkal, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Edged and gone. Maiden IPL wicket for Yash Dayal! 136.2kph, short of length delivery with a bit of extra bounce outside off. Padikkal sees the width outside off and wafts his bat hard at it. The ball flies off the outside edge but Gill shows good reflexes at first slip. Leaps slightly to his right to take an overhead catch. Padikkal c Shubman Gill b Yash Dayal 0(1)

Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.
team_b_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11). Commentary Text: Yash Dayal to Buttler, SIX, 139.6kph, Buttler is on fire! Plays a premeditated, cute shot. Walks across a long way and scoops this full ball outside off over fine leg. The timing's so good that it has gone all the way for half-a-dozen! Dayal under pressure!

Commentary Text: Yash Dayal to Buttler, FOUR, fifth boundary for Buttler! Buttler stands tall on the back foot, waits for this back of a length ball and punches firmly past the cover fielder. Superb placement and exquisite timing

Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

team_a_subs: Preview by Kritika Naidu  The overview:  Little separates Rajasthan Royals and the Gujarat Titans after four games in the 2022 edition. They're both tied on 6 points with three wins and a loss. Between both captains, Sanju Samson and Hardik Pandya, they've won just the one toss; RR are yet to chase in the tournament.  But most importantly, both sides' pacers have dominated the powerplay phase this season - with Trent Boult & Prasidh Krishna for RR, Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Lockie Ferguson for GT. RR's pacers have picked up 8 wickets, averaging 14.25, while GT's have 9 wickets at 17.00. Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have been the most successful bowlers in the middle overs since IPL 2017, averaging 20.21 and 20.97 with 70 and 60 wickets respectively.  Gujarat, meanwhile, were handed their first loss of the season after an eight-wicket trouncing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad. One aspect that has hurt GT has been their opening stand which hasn't survived a powerplay so far. In the four games, their first-wicket stands have been worth: 4, 2, 32 and 24. Left-hander Sai Sudarshan batting at No.3 now provides break in the run of right-handers at the top. Matthew Wade will likely make way for Rahmanullah Gurbaz, considering his inability to get starts so far and factoring in the latter's superior record in Asia. Gurbaz, in 68 innings, has amassed 1620 runs at an average of 24.17, striking at a dangerous 151.82 as opposed to Wade's 93.36. The middle-order too has been needing to get among the runs with David Miller yet to fire.  Samson too has had little success after the first game; it's evident he's struggling when pace is taken off in what has been his slowest start to a season in the last six years. His game has been found wanting on slower tracks in the past, and with tracks set to slow down as the season progress, his form could be a cause of concern for the Royals. Shimron Hetmyer's display of power and skill in the death, though, has done RR a world of good. He's striking at close to 200 and has contributed in all four games so far. Gujarat will want to contain him in the death, with Rashid having the wood over him, but GT may have vital strategic decisions to make as to how Rashid should be used.  When: RR vs GT, April 14, 19:30 IST  Where: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, NaviMumbai  What to expect: The CSK-RCB game was played on a used wicket, with it being so dry that the dust on it was palpable. The spinners played a crucial role in the second innings with 7 wickets shared between Mahesh Theekshana and Ravindra Jadeja. If a similar wicket is on offer, both sides have the arsenal to use it to their advantage. The average first innings total has come down from 177 in 11 games in the first week (March 26-April 3) to 163 in 10 in the second week (April 4-11).  Team Watch:  Rajasthan Royals  Tactics & Matchups: Miller has struggled against both Chahal and Ashwin, falling to them thrice each. If RR's pacers strike early as they have so far in the season, then the spin duo will fancy their chance to break into the middle order early.  Probable XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal/Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jimmy Neesham, Navdeep Saini, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal  Gujarat Titans  B7$ Rashid Khan will have a big role to play in containing the dangerous Jos Buttler and later in the order, Shimron Hetmyer - both of who have been among the runs this season. Rashid has a good record against the two dismissing them four times, especially with Buttler averaging just 4.50 against the legspinner.  Probable XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz/Matthew Wade (wk), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya (c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Abhinav Manohar, Rashid Khan, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Shami, Darshan Nalkande  Did you know?  - There was seven first innings totals in excess of 170 in the first 11 matches and just two in the ten subsequent matches, both in Brabourne.  - Only Bumrah has taken more wickets than the duo of Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal in the last half-a-decade in the IPL. And in the middle overs, the two spinners sit on top of the wicket charts.  - Hetmyer has the second-highest strike-rate in death overs since IPL 2019 behind AB de Villiers. He strikes at 195.95 with a boundary percentage of 27.3.  What they said:  "The toss is not in our control. We are learning to adapt our game keeping the dew factor in mind. Both toss and the subsequent dew in the second half of the game is out of our hands," Padikkal said.

Commentary Text: Shami to Buttler, FOUR, 140.5kph, Buttler gets off the mark in style! Overpitched outside off, Buttler leans forward and crisply drives through extra cover. All along the carpet and into the fence

Commentary Text: Shami to Buttler, no run, 138.5kph, Buttler walks forward and across to flick. Wade catches it down leg and throws the ball up straightaway, a confident appeal for Shami as well, the umpire is unmoved however. GT send it upstairs. No spike on UltraEdge as the ball passes the bat. It brushed the batter's pad! The onfield call stays and Gujarat lose a review off the very first delivery...
team_a_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Rassie van der Dussen, Shimron Hetmyer, James Neesham, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Sen, Prasidh Krishna, Yuzvendra Chahal
